alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 10:17AM CST until February 15 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Clarke, Choctaw and Washington Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 29.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 28.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise above flood stage late Sunday morning to 29.2 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 29 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob.
